section.title: Target
section.para: In the following exercise you create a standard Eclipse plug-in. This plug-in is later converted into an Eclipse RCP application.

note.para: The following description calls this plug-in the application plug-in as this plug-in will contain the main application logic.

section.title: Creating a plug-in project
section.para:
In Eclipse select
File New Other... Plug-in Development Plug-in Project
.
Give your plug-in the name com.example.e4.rcp.todo and press the Next button.

textobject.phrase: First page of the Eclipse Plug-in Wizard specifying the project name.

section.para: On the next wizard page make the following settings. Select No at the Would you like to create a rich client application? option and uncheck This plug-in will make contributions to the UI . Uncheck the Generate an activator, a Java class that controls the plug-in's life cycle option.

textobject.phrase: Second page of the Eclipse Plug-in Wizard specifying the plug-in ID, version, Name, Activator and the RCP type.

section.para: Press the Finish button. If you click the Next button instead of Finish , the wizard shows you a template selection page which you can bypass without a selection.

section.title: Validate the result
section.para: Open the project and ensure that no Java classes were created in the source folder.
In the manifest editor switch to the Dependencies tab and ensure that there are no entries.
